title: L.A. routed 18-1 in worst loss at Dodger Stadium
content: The Dodgers took a 17-run defeat on the chin Friday night, falling 18-1 to the Astros in the team's worst loss ever at Dodger Stadium.

title: Source: Liverpool players to attend Jota's funeral
content: Diogo Jota's Liverpool teammates will attend the funeral of the 28-year-old and his brother André Silva in Portugal on Saturday, a source told ESPN.

title: Raleigh ties M's record with 35 HRs before break
content: Cal Raleigh matched Ken Griffey Jr.'s franchise record for home runs before the All-Star break, hitting his 34th and 35th homers of the season Friday in a 6-0 win over the Pirates.

title: Different Soto propels Mets to Subway Series win
content: Juan Soto went 3-for-4 with a home run, double and single, falling just a triple shy of the cycle in the Mets' 6-5 comeback win over the Yankees on Friday.

title: Sheinbaum hopes Chávez Jr. does time in Mexico
content: President Claudia Sheinbaum says she hopes boxer Julio César Chávez Jr., who was arrested Wednesday in Los Angeles for overstaying his visa, "will be deported and serve the sentence in Mexico."

title: Fever's Clark to miss 5th straight Sat. vs. Sparks
content: Fever star Caitlin Clark will miss her fifth straight game with a left groin injury Saturday when Indiana plays host to the LA Sparks.

title: Chestnut reclaims Nathan's hot dog contest title
content: Famed competitive eater Joey Chestnut reclaimed his title at the Nathan's Famous Fourth of July hot dog eating contest after after skipping last year's gastronomic battle in New York for the coveted Mustard Belt.

title: 'Really cool': Cubs launch franchise-record 8 HRs
content: The Cubs set a franchise record with eight home runs in an 11-3 rout of the Reds on Friday, including three from first baseman Michael Busch.

title: ❤️ Oasis pays tribute to Diogo Jota on tour
content: Oasis began its comeback tour Friday night in front of a sold-out crowd at Principality Stadium in Cardiff, Wales. During the show, the band paid its respects to the late Liverpool forward Diogo Jota.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: USMNT still hasn't had a convincing win since Mauricio Pochettino took over. Time is running out
content: Since Pochettino became USMNT coach, the team still hasn't had a signature win. The Gold Cup final vs. Mexico is the last chance before the 2026 World Cup.

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: The Mexican-American playmaker is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: A club defined by disorder, Chelsea reach Club World Cup semis like only they know how
content: On a day they were fined by UEFA and scored on by one of their future players, Chelsea still found a way to defeat Palmeiras and reach the Club World Cup semifinals.

title: 'The great ones know how to find it': Why K.C. still expects the best from Travis Kelce
content: Chiefs coaches and teammates don't doubt Kelce's ability to step up in clutch moments again like he did in the playoffs last season.

title: Who’s the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever? No. 10? No. 262?!? We named top all-time selections at every slot
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: British Grand Prix at 75: Silverstone, Aintree, Brands Hatch in pictures
content: IN PHOTOS: ESPN looks through the 75-year history of the British Grand Prix in all its guises at Aintree, Brands Hatch and Silverstone.

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen refused to comment on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: UEFA fines Chelsea, Barçelona over violations
content: Chelsea were fined €20 million for breaking financial monitoring rules and Barcelona were ordered to pay €15m by UEFA on Friday.

title: Young USMNT ready for 'hostile' crowd vs. Mexico
content: USMNT's Walker Zimmerman said that the Gold Cup semifinal win over Guatemala was a "good taste" of what it's like to play in a hostile environment.

title: Sources: Utd tell wantaway stars to delay return
content: Manchester United have told five players including Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho to delay their return to training to allow them more time to find moves away from the club, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey charged with rape
content: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault by the Metropolitan Police Service.

title: 'Devastated': Liverpool teammates grieve Jota
content: Diogo Jota's teammates at Liverpool including Virgil van Dijk and Jordan Henderson have been expressing their grief following the forward's death.

title: Source: Messi, Miami remain in contract talks
content: Negotiations between Inter Miami CF and Lionel Messi over a contract extension remain ongoing, a source told ESPN.

title: Williams shuns Barça, signs 10-year Athletic deal
content: Nico Williams has signed a new contract with Athletic Club until 2035, snubbing Barcelona's advances to sign him from the Basque side this summer.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Brand's long-range strike sparks Germany
content: A stunning goal by Jule Brand helped send Germany past Poland, as Sweden edged rivals Denmark. Here's what you need to know from Friday's Euro 2025 action.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Fantasy Baseball Forecaster for Week 16: July 7-13
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead with our forecaster, which has pitcher rankings, hitter ratings and more.

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eye move for Madrid's García
content: Chelsea are willing to pay €40m to land 21-year-old Real Madrid forward Gonzalo García. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Muharram beyond the main procession: the pulse of faith in smaller ashoorkhanas
content: Far from the public glare and ceremonial avenues, Hyderabad’s lesser known ashoorkhanas hold a quieter, deeper rhythm of Muharram where the legacy of Karbala endures through fading walls, whispered laments and generations of unbroken faith

title: Nitin Gadkari to inaugurate Sigandur bridge in Shivamogga on July 14, says B.Y. Raghavendra
content: BJP leader Raghavendra appealed to the State Government to send a proposal to the Centre on naming the bridge after Sigandur Chowdeshwari, the deity worshipped by many in the district.

title: High-quality diet may have led to bigger human brain: CSIR-CCMB-led international study reveals genetic link between diet and brain size
content: An international study involving scientists from the United States and China, has uncovered the genetic mechanisms linking diet quality and brain size in primates; it reveals that the quality of food primates eat influences not just their energy levels but also the way their brains evolve at the genetic level

title: Modi will bow to Donald Trump: Rahul Gandhi attacks Prime Minister as deal deadline approaches
content: The U.S. President Donald Trump has set a deadline of July 9 to finalise the trade agreement with India.

title: Dalai Lama says he hopes to live for another 40 years
content: Dalai Lama was speaking during a ceremony by his followers to offer prayers for his long life ahead of his 90th birthday on July 6, 2025.

title: One dead, more feared trapped after portion of illegal coal mine collapses in Jharkhand
content: An administrative team has been dispatched for relief and rescue operation at Karma area in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district

title: JSK – Janaki v/s State of Kerala row: High Court judge watches controversial movie at Kochi film studio
content: Kerala High Court, which is considering a petition by film’s production company seeking a directive to CBFC to issue censor certificate, had earlier stated that it was appropriate to watch the movie before arriving at a decision

title: Odisha BJP reluctant to defend party leader Jagannath Pradhan arrested for attack on govt. officer
content: The saffron party is concerned over its image following stampede in Puri and spate of gang-rape incidents

title: 36 Amarnath pilgrims suffer minor injuries after 5 buses collide in J&K’s Ramban
content: The buses were part of a convoy headed for Pahalgam base camp in south Kashmir from Jammu's Bhagwati Nagar

title: Mohan Majhi govt. to upgrade Puri into municipal corporation
content: The new corporation will include Puri town and seven to eight panchayats from the adjoining Brahmagiri block

title: Ladli Behna Yojana monthly aid to be ₹1,500 after Diwali: M.P. CM Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav said a special budget of ₹27,147 crore has been earmarked for women, including ₹18,699 crore for the Ladli Behna scheme

title: IMD issues alert for heavy rain in parts of Jharkhand
content: The alert has been sounded for Gumla, Simdega, Khunti and West Singhbhum districts, which are likely to experience torrential rain between 8.30 a.m. on July 6, 2025 and 8.30 a.m. on July 7, 2025

title: Fourth batch of 6,900 Amarnath pilgrims leave Jammu base camp for Kashmir
content: The fourth batch of 6,979 pilgrims left the Bhagwati Nagar base camp in two separate convoys between 3.30 a.m. and 4.05 a.m. amid tight security

title: Telangana Congress’s ‘Samajika Nyaya Bheri’ reignites party cadre ahead of local body polls
content: The strong message delivered by both the AICC president Mallikarjun Kharge and Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy sent a signal that the Congress was not down, as claimed by the Opposition parties

title: Allegations of tender irregularity, fraud at Deocha-Pachami coal project ‘baseless’: WBPDCL
content: The West Bengal Power Development Corporation, to whom the coal mine was allocated, was accused of fraud, breach of tender guidelines, and allotment agreement by CPI(M) the day before

title: ED provisionally attaches ₹34.12 crore worth properties of Ranya Rao
content: The ED said the attachments have been made as “property equivalent in value to the untraced proceeds of crime identified during the course of investigation” under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002

title: Gujarat Congress seeks probe into MGNREGA, Nal Se Jal scams
content: The party claimed Mr. Khabad’s sons Balvantsinh and Kirit, arrested in the scam, had direct involvement along with the Minister’s aides

title: Women now lead 1 in 3 Gujarat dairy cooperatives as participation soars
content: Gujarat sees growth in women-led dairy cooperatives, boosting milk procurement and rural economy, aligning with cooperative sector reforms

title: Businessman and BJP leader Gopal Khemka shot dead in Patna
content: Bike-borne criminals opened fire when Khemka was stepping out from his car near his house. He was also the owner of petrol pumps apart from running several other industries.

title: Thane illegal mining: Bombay High Court orders recovery of over ₹190 crore penalty
content: For years, tribal residents of Chinchavli village in Ambernath endured the destruction of their hills and the rise of dust-related illnesses.

title: Centre notifies rules on portal, database, audit of Waqf properties
content: New rules for Waqf management, registration, and audit published, with a portal and database for streamlined processes

title: Jaishankar set to visit China for SCO meet; possible visit by Wang to India later this month
content: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi may also visit India this month to hold a fresh round of talks with NSA Ajit Doval under the framework of Special Representatives (SR) dialogue on the boundary dispute

title: PM Modi arrives in Argentina on two-day visit
content: “We will focus on advancing our mutually beneficial cooperation, including in the areas of agriculture, critical minerals, energy, trade, tourism, technology, and investment,” PM Modi said, on talks with President Javier Milei

title: India, Trinidad & Tobago ink six pacts to expand ties
content: The two leaders also explored potential collaboration in areas of defence, agriculture, healthcare and digital transformation, unified payments interface (UPI), capacity building and people-to-people exchanges

title: Aaditya Thackeray slams BJP for clearing Pakistan to play in hockey tournament
content: Soon, BCCI will give the green signal for Pakistan to participate in the Cricket Asia Cup if the people of the country do not object, says Aaditya Thackeray.

title: Alcaraz marches on at Wimbledon after tough test, Keys and Osaka crash
content: That match began a tad belatedly with Alcaraz pushed to the limit and taken to four sets by German Jan-Lennard Struff before the second seed prevailed 6-1 3-6 6-3 6-4 after some luck towards the end of the match.

title: Groom among 5 killed in accident in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal
content: The deceased have been identified as Suraj (24), the groom, son of Sukh Ram; his sister-in-law Asha (26); her daughter Aishwarya (2) and Vishnu (6), son of Manoj; and an unidentified person.

title: ‘Naxalism confined to just five, six districts’, says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
content: I would also like to say, if any such mischief (Pahalgam terror attack) takes place in future, we will give befitting to reply to terrorism with the same strength, says Defence Minister Rajnath Singh

title: Webinar on ‘Vitamin D Deficiency: Myths vs Reality’ to be held on July 6
content: The webinar will offer valuable guidance and actionable tips on identifying, managing and preventing Vitamin D deficiency across age groups

title: Bengaluru court restrains Kamal Haasan from making statements defaming Kannada
content: The court also restrained the actor from posting, issuing or publishing or making any statement or remarks claiming linguistic superiority over Kannada language.

title: Kailash Manasarovar Yatra: Pilgrims’ progress
content: With India-China ties improving, the Kailash Manasarovar Yatra has resumed after a nearly six-year hiatus. Of about 5,000 applicants, the Ministry of External Affairs chose 750 pilgrims this year. While both pilgrims and workers in Tibet are happy about the resumption of the yatra, they are concerned about rising temperatures. Suhasini Haidar and Rahul Karmakar report on what it takes to make the arduous trek to a site considered sacred by followers of many religions

title: SC stays Madras HC’s decision to halt T.N. govt. recruitment process to fill 2,569 vacancies
content: The HC’s interim order on April 3 was based on the ground that T.N. failed to select four candidates under the Person Studying in Tamil Medium quota; the process of recruitment was virtually complete with only final appointment letters to be issued to selected candidates, says govt.

title: CJI Gavai assures ‘complete transparency’ in the collegium system for appointments
content: The CJI pledges to ensure inclusive representation and fairness in appointments, while speaking at a felicitation event of the Bombay Bar Association

title: Anti-rabies vaccine alone is not enough when children suffer deep stray dog bites, says Tamil Nadu Directorate of Public Health
content: Re-emphasising the set of scientific guidelines that healthcare workers should strictly adhere to, the directorate said two boys, who were bitten by stray dogs in Kerala, died despite being vaccinated.

title: SCR, NDRF, Civil Defence Organisation hold mock drill on rescuing passengers during train mishaps
content: The safety, Signal and Telecommunication (S&T) and the Emergency Response Teams rescued the ‘victims’ from the bogies through cradle lift, human crutch, hand-seat and pick-a-back methods

title: Kangana says she hasn't visited Mandi on Jai Ram Thakur's 'advise'; Congress takes jibe
content: Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu on Friday asked Ms. Ranaut to speak to Mr. Thakur and said the Leader of the Opposition was "getting angry"

title: Supreme Court stays Madras HC’s decision to halt TN govt recruitment to fill up 2,569 vacancies in MAWS
content: The interim order of the High Court on April 3 had brought to a grinding stop a recruitment process which was nearly complete

title: Army hosts curtain-raiser for Tri-Services Academia Technology Symposium in Delhi
content: The primary objective of the symposium is to develop an integrated perspective for creating a synergised services–academia research and development ecosystem

title: Gram Sabhas hold authority to prepare CFR management plans, says Centre
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry clarifies role of Union and State departments is to support, not supersede, Gram Sabhas

title: Congress renews call for discussion on India-China ties
content: Congress general secretary (communication) Jairam Ramesh said that for the last five years his party has been demanding an in-depth debate in Parliament on the full gamut of Indo-China relations, which the Modi government has consistently refused

title: Families of 47 victims of Air India 171 crash victims receive interim payout; lawyers warn against forgoing rights for full compensation
content: Interim compensation of ₹25 lakh is part of the minimum legal liability for airlines in case of death or bodily injury for international flights defined under International Civil Aviation Organisation’s Montreal Convention 1999; experts say that compensations can far exceed the limits laid down under Montreal Convention

title: Union Government to start accepting Haj applications for 2026 from next week
content: Terming the management of Haj 2025 as historic, Mr. Rijiju said that “it was one of the most successful ever”. Highlighting that the fatality rate has gone down to 64 this year from 220 in 2024, the Minister also gave credit of Haj’s success to the External Affairs Ministry, Civil Aviation Ministry and the Health Ministry.

title: Special Intensive Revision: Enumeration forms given to 87% electors in Bihar, says Election Commission
content: Nearly 38 lakh people have submitted the forms; booth-level officers will again visit houses found locked in the first round

title: Bihar polls can be held based on 2024 electoral rolls: D. Raja
content: CPI General Secretary D. Raja urges the Election Commission to postpone voter roll revision in Bihar to prevent exclusion

title: Wait continues for Devanahalli farmers as CM seeks 10 days to examine legal issues
content: While the next meeting is scheduled on July 15, the farmer leaders and activists have decided to continue their protest at the 13 villages where lands are proposed to be acquired

title: Trinidad and Tobago will be a priority nation for India: PM Modi
content: Terrorism is enemy of humanity, global community must stand united to deny it any shelter or space, PM Modi said

title: Allow Aadhaar and ration cards as key documents for Bihar special revision of electoral roll: INDIA bloc
content: A delegation, led by coordination committee head Tejashwi Yadav, submitted its demands to the State Chief Electoral Officer; Rashtriya Janata Dal’s national executive body that met in Patna opposed the exercise to revise the voters’ list

title: HC imposes ₹50,000 costs on Competent Officer (Evacuee Properties)
content: The judge noted that the competent officer failed to adjudicate the matter even after lapse of 25 years

title: Won’t allow ‘sinister exercise’ of poll roll revision in Bihar, says Congress
content: “The unnecessary haste, and their absolute refusal to address genuine concerns raised by Opposition, point to there being a clear effort to destroy the electoral system in Bihar,” says K.C. Venugopal

title: Manipur government sets December target to close relief camps as phased resettlement begins
content: Chief Secretary P.K. Singh says Centre, State government, and CSOs (civil society organisations) are working towards the resettlement of the internally displaced people

title: Seawall construction at Chellanam to be completed in time-bound manner
content: Seawall to prevent erosion and boost beach tourism, says Minister; 7.3 km completed, funds sanctioned for remaining 3.5 km

title: Nipah restrictions in 20 wards in Malappuram, 6 in Palakkad
content: N-95 mask made mandatory for people in containment zones; residents warned against chasing away bats as stressed bats may produce more bodily fluids, potentially increasing the risk of virus transmission

title: ‘To emerge as a true global power, India must secure technological sovereignty’
content: Ajay Kumar Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India, delivers the convocation address of VTU

title: ‘Open the Yellow Line’: Public frustration peaks over constant deferral of metro launch
content: The much-anticipated corridor, which links R.V. Road with Bommasandra via the tech hub of Electronics City, remains unopened despite civil work being largely completed

title: 345 people on  Nipah contact list in Kerala
content: Experts caution people that roosting bats should not be disturbed by bursting crackers or by any other means. Health department directs affected districts to strengthen contact tracing by focussing around hospitals and other health-care institutions and to ensure that none are missed when preparing the contact lists

title: Bizman Gopal Khemka shot dead outside Patna house; 6 years after son's killing
content: Businessman Gopal Khemka was murdered near Gandhi Maidan in Patna, mirroring the earlier killing of his son, BJP leader Gunjan Khemka, in 2018. Police are investigating the shooting, having recovered a bullet and shell from the scene. The incident has sparked political criticism, with RJD leaders condemning the government's handling of law and order.

title: 'Take it or leave it': Trump says US tariff letters ready for 12 countries
content: US President Donald Trump is set to send tariff letters to twelve countries starting Monday, with new reciprocal rates potentially effective from August 1, 2025. Trump’s letters will be sent with the American side indicating a ‘take it or leave it’ offers.

title: Watch: Rijiju attends Dalai Lama's b'day celebration; strong msg to China
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju and Arunachal Pradesh CM Pema Khandu attended the Dalai Lama's birthday celebrations in Dharamshala, following a dispute between China and India over his succession. China urged India to handle Tibet-related issues cautiously after Rijiju stated the Dalai Lama's reincarnation should be his own decision. The MEA clarified India's neutrality on the selection process, emphasizing religious freedom.

title: Beijing says can't afford Russia losing in Ukraine, wants US distracted: Report
content: Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi reportedly told the EU that Beijing views a Russian defeat in Ukraine as unacceptable, fearing it would allow the US to concentrate on China. Despite China's official neutrality, Wang's comments suggest a preference for a prolonged conflict that keeps the US engaged.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years: Founding country manager says...
content: After 25 years, Microsoft is reportedly exiting Pakistan, a move confirmed by the founding head of Microsoft Pakistan, Jawwad Rehman, via a LinkedIn post. The company commenced operations in June 2000 but has gradually reduced its presence.

title: B'luru horror: Drunk man dies in sleep after wife hits him with stick
content: A Bengaluru civil engineer, Bhaskar, died after his wife, Shruthi, struck him with a wooden stick during a domestic dispute. Shruthi claims self-defense, alleging years of abuse and provocation after Bhaskar returned home intoxicated from an affair. The postmortem revealed blunt-force trauma. Shruthi is now in judicial custody, with police considering her claims.

title: 'Modi will meekly bow': Rahul reacts to Piyush Goyal's US trade deal remark
content: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi, anticipating he would yield to Trump's tariff deadline amid US trade talks. Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to protecting its national interests, particularly for farmers and industries, during negotiations. While the US seeks tariff reductions on agricultural products, India aims for concessions in labor-intensive sectors like textiles and leather.

title: 'Promises made, promises kept': Trump signs 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' into law
content: US President Donald Trump signed the "One, Big, Beautiful Bill" into law during a Fourth of July celebration. The legislation includes tax cuts, increased military and immigration enforcement spending, and Medicaid reductions. The Department of Homeland Security lauded the bill's $165 billion appropriation, emphasizing its support for border security and deportation efforts.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: 36 Amarnath pilgrims injured after five buses collide in J&K's Ramban
content: Near the Chanderkot Langer site, five buses in a convoy of Amarnath pilgrims collided on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway, resulting in minor injuries to 36 pilgrims. The incident occurred around 8 am as the buses traveled from Jammu to Pahalgam. Injured pilgrims received immediate medical attention at Ramban district hospital, and alternative transportation was arranged for their onward journey.

title: Chess | Gukesh reveals bet with cousin if he beat Carlsen; leads by 3 points in Zagreb
content: D Gukesh triumphed in the SuperUnited Rapid & Blitz tournament's rapid section in Zagreb, highlighted by a victory against World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen. After an initial loss, Gukesh demonstrated resilience with five consecutive wins, securing his lead. He concluded the rapid section with a win against Wesley So and aims to maintain his form in the upcoming blitz format.

title: 'Brace yourself for Siraj storm': Video montage celebrates pacer’s spell | Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's sensational six-wicket haul against England at Edgbaston was immortalized in a video showcasing his journey from humble beginnings to cricket stardom. His figures of 6/70 not only dented England’s top order but also etched his name in history as he joined the ranks of Indian bowling legends at the venue.

title: Musk reiterates push to deorbit ISS: SpaceX CEO says ‘It’s time to retire…’
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: Marathi cause reunites Thackeray brothers, to hold joint mega rally in Mumbai
content: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray are set to share a stage after 20 years for a joint rally celebrating the withdrawal of government resolutions related to the three-language policy. The rally, organized by Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS, marks a rare instance of unity between the cousins, focusing on Marathi language and identity.

title: Why PM Modi's Argentina trip is vital for India's clean energy ambitions
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Argentina marks the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 57 years, aiming to strengthen ties in areas like energy, critical minerals, and trade. Discussions with President Javier Milei will focus on cooperation in agriculture, mining, and renewable energy, with India eyeing Argentina's shale reserves and lithium resources for energy security.

title: Caught on camera: Runaway pet lion attacks woman, kids in Lahore
content: In Lahore, Pakistan, a runaway pet lion attacked a woman and two children on a busy street, prompting a swift police response. The lion, escaping its enclosure, injured the victims before being captured and taken to a wildlife sanctuary. Authorities arrested three individuals in connection with the incident, highlighting ongoing concerns about exotic animal ownership in the region.

title: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce take a big step in their relationship away from the cameras
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce enjoyed a peaceful summer in 2025. They spent quality time in New York, Nashville, and other quiet locations. This helped strengthen their relationship. Swift also regained ownership of her master recordings. Kelce supported her during this achievement. As the NFL season approaches, Swift will likely support Kelce at games.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs' European vacation with a cryptic 3-word message that fans can’t ignore
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: New twist in Carter Hart to Edmonton Oilers talk sparks speculation a rumor in NHL
content: New layers continue to emerge in the Carter Hart to Edmonton Oilers speculation. After NHL insider Kevin Weekes surprised fans by linking Hart to Edmonton during TSN’s Free Agent show, new local ties and past connections raise questions. As Hart awaits a July 24 verdict in the 2018 sexual assault case, the Oilers’ potential interest could ignite a major PR storm.

title: Yuvika Chaudhary: 24 hours of my day are spent juggling between motherhood and work
content: Actress Yuvika Chaudhary, mother to baby Ekleen, balances motherhood and her career. Speaking to Times of India TV, she acknowledges the entertainment industry's challenges, highlighting her and husband Prince Narula's self-made success. Yuvika cherishes the unique atmosphere of being on set and misses reading long scripts.

title: IND v ENG: Jaiswal breaks Gavaskar’s 49-year record; joins elite list with Dravid & Sehwag
content: Young India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal equaled Rahul Dravid and Virender Sehwag as the joint-fastest Indian to 2,000 Test runs, achieving the milestone in his 40th innings during the second Test against England. He also became the fastest Indian to the mark in terms of matches played, reaching it in 21 Tests.

title: Twist in Pune rape case: No forced entry, use of spray; selfie with consent
content: Pune police are investigating a rape allegation made by a 22-year-old data scientist against a supposed delivery agent. Commissioner Amitesh Kumar stated there was no forced entry or use of chemicals. The woman's friend, an IT professional, has been detained after his phone location placed him at the flat during the alleged incident.

title: Cricket | Shastri, DK or Sanga? And the best dressed commentator goes to ...
content: During the India-England Test match, a lighthearted fashion contest emerged among the Sky Sports commentary team. Michael Atherton initiated the banter by criticising Nasser Hussain's casual attire, leading to a humorous awards ceremony. Ravi Shastri ultimately claimed the title of "Best Dressed Commentator" with his stylish white jacket, celebrated for its flair and confidence.

title: Kolkata horror: 'Keep room ready', Monojit told guard before assault
content: Manojit Mishra instructed a security guard to prepare a room before the law college gang rape. The guard, Pinaki Banerjee, was aware of parties in the room. He was threatened to remain silent. Other accused instructed Banerjee to leave his post. Police reconstructed the crime scene with the accused. They are investigating social media activity and Monojit's employment status.

title: Exclusive | 'They bring the best out of me' - Pogacar on rivalry with Vingegaard, Evenepoel
content: Tadej Pogacar, a strong contender after his Critérium du Dauphiné win, aims for his fourth Tour de France victory. Facing rivals like Jonas Vingegaard and Remco Evenepoel, Pogacar emphasises the importance of mental strength, nutrition, and teamwork in the demanding 21-stage race. He highlights the unique beauty and challenges of Grand Tours, fueled by his love for cycling.

title: Govt doesn't take stand on matters of faith, says MEA on Dalai succession issue
content: India has clarified its stance on the Dalai Lama's succession, stating it doesn't take a position on religious matters, despite a minister's personal support for the Dalai Lama's wishes. This comes as China cautioned India against interfering in Tibetan affairs, a comment later omitted from their official briefing transcript.

title: Raza Murad reveals Madhuri Dixit’s parents arranged her marriage after her initial failures
content: Madhuri Dixit faced a series of flops early in her career, prompting her parents to consider arranging her marriage after witnessing her struggle in the film industry. Later, she was re-launched by Subhash Ghai in Ram Lakhan, a film that transformed her career trajectory. Actor Raza Murad has cited Madhuri as an example while speaking about the role of luck in surviving the industry.

title: FIFA CWC: Neves, Cancelo break down; Neto carries special shirt in honour of Jota, Silva - watch
content: Al-Hilal players Ruben Neves and João Cancelo were inconsolable during the minute's silence for Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva who died in a car crash this week. During the FIFA Club World Cup quarter-finals, Chelsea's Pedro Neto paid tribute with a special shirt.

title: Trump's July 4 fireworks: 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' signed - Here's what it means
content: President Trump signed the "big, beautiful bill" into law, extending the 2017 tax cuts and increasing funding for border security. The legislation, passed with narrow margins in both the House and Senate, also includes major reductions in Medicaid spending and changes to SNAP benefits. It raises the debt ceiling and increases the state and local tax deduction temporarily.

title: Tom Brady’s Fourth of July tribute goes viral as he honors both America and his mother
content: Tom Brady celebrated his mother Galynn's birthday on July 4th. He posted a heartfelt tribute on Instagram. He acknowledged her strength, especially during her cancer battle. Galynn was diagnosed in 2016. She attended Super Bowl LI in 2017. Brady also recognized her initial hesitation about his football career. He credited his parents for instilling important values.

title: Amazon reaches new milestone, becomes world’s largest manufacturer and operator of…
content: Amazon has reached a milestone by deploying one million robots across its facilities and introducing "DeepFleet," a new AI model to optimize robot fleet efficiency. This move aims to reduce travel time and enhance delivery speeds. While Amazon emphasizes robots working alongside humans and creating new roles, CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges potential workforce reduction due to increased automation.

title: Farah Khan asks Munawar Faruqui to compare his jail term and Bigg Boss
content: In a recent vlog with Farah Khan, Munawar Faruqui candidly discussed his experiences, drawing a stark contrast between his time in jail and his Bigg Boss journey, emphasizing the incomparable nature of the two.

title: IND v ENG: 'It's unbelievable' - Siraj joins Kapil in elite club with sensational spell
content: Mohammed Siraj etched his name in Indian cricket history, securing a remarkable 6/70 against England at Edgbaston. This feat places him among legends like Kapil Dev and Ishant Sharma. Siraj's performance is the best by an Indian at the ground since 1986.

title: 'India has navigated uncertainty very well, exports may top $870bn': Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce minister Piyush Goyal anticipates record exports, driven by FTAs, despite global uncertainties. Investment is flowing into key sectors, with a focus on value-added and labor-intensive exports. The government is reviewing FTAs with Asean and Japan, while remaining cautious on trade relations with China, aiming for fair and balanced trade.

title: 2020 election loss, assassination attempt: Trump shares 'best life evolution' video - watch
content: Donald Trump, in a video released on July 4th, acknowledged his 2020 election defeat for the first time. The video, titled ‘Best life evolution video of President Donald J Trump,’ chronicles his life from childhood to his business and political career.

title: LeBron James responds after viral Cleveland Cavaliers' photo triggers Lakers exit rumors
content: A photo sparked rumours of LeBron James returning to Cleveland Cavaliers. James clarified he was simply training in his hometown. He remains committed to Los Angeles Lakers. He opted into his contract. The Lakers reshaped their roster. James' agent said he wants another championship. Insiders say the Cavaliers are not interested in a reunion. The Lakers aim for stability.

title: Months before AI Dreamliner crash, DGCA warned Air India Express on Airbus engine fixes
content: Air India Express faced DGCA scrutiny for allegedly falsifying compliance documents related to Airbus A320 engine maintenance, following a European Union Aviation Safety Agency directive. The airline reportedly missed deadlines for replacing critical engine components, prompting internal disciplinary actions.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' day 15: Aamir Khan starrer sees a slight dip; inches closer to Rs 140 cr
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D'Souza's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' released on June 20, 2025, continues its successful run, nearing ₹140 crore in domestic earnings after 15 days. Despite a minor drop on its second Friday, the film's occupancy rates improved, especially during evening and night shows. Aamir Khan expressed gratitude for the audience's warm reception and positive reviews.

title: Army deputy chief: Op Sindoor faced 3 foes - Pakistan, China & Turkiye
content: During Operation Sindoor, India faced a complex challenge with Pakistan, actively supported by China and Turkiye, according to a top Army officer. China provided Pakistan with real-time satellite intelligence on Indian military movements. Pakistan used Chinese weaponry, while Turkiye supplied drones. The conflict highlighted the need for improved C4ISR, air defense, and civil-military fusion.

title: National interest, not deadline, to dictate US trade deal: Piyush Goyal
content: India will only agree to a trade deal with the US if it safeguards national interests and provides a sustainable tariff advantage, according to Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Prioritizing farmers' interests, India aims for duty concessions in labor-intensive sectors like leather and textiles.

title: Free sanitary pad packs with Rahul Gandhi's pic stir Bihar poll row
content: Congress's initiative to distribute sanitary pads with Rahul Gandhi's image in Bihar sparked controversy, drawing criticism from NDA leaders who deemed it an insult to women. The scheme, aimed at promoting menstrual hygiene, faced backlash as opponents questioned the appropriateness of featuring a male figure on sanitary products.

title: Lord Ram, Bihar common thread as PM Modi addresses diaspora in Port of Spain
content: Addressing the Indian diaspora in Port of Spain, PM Modi highlighted the shared roots in Bihar, particularly referencing PM Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki beti." He acknowledged the hardships faced by indentured laborers and praised their enduring faith, especially their devotion to Lord Ram.

title: 2 girls among top 3 in CUET-UG, Delhi boy bags second position
content: The CUET-UG 2025 results saw two women among the top three, with Ananya Jain leading. Despite high scores, candidates are questioning syllabus deviations, errors, and the normalisation process. While registrations increased slightly, the number of test-takers declined, and fewer universities participated amid concerns about the exam's framework. Frustration persists over discrepancies, especially in the physical education paper.

title: Herald case against Sonia Gandhi 'truly strange': Abhishek Singhvi in court
content: Abhishek Manu Singhvi, representing Sonia Gandhi, argued in a Delhi court that the ED's National Herald case is a peculiar money-laundering case lacking property movement or gains for Congress leaders. He questioned the 11-year delay between AJL's restructuring and ED's action, asserting that no property shifted from Associated Journals Ltd to Young Indian Pvt Ltd.

title: Kangana Ranaut vs Jairam Thakur on Mandi floods?: BJP MP clarifies on her absence
content: A BJP feud surfaces in flood-hit Himachal Pradesh as MP Kangana Ranaut claims Jairam Thakur advised her to delay visiting Mandi due to connectivity issues, contradicting his earlier criticism of her absence. Chief Minister Sukhu seized on the apparent discord between the two leaders. The state government announced relief measures for affected families, including rental assistance and food supplies.

title: "Distance No Barrier For Cultural Connect": PM Modi To Indian Community In Argentina
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said that he was honoured to receive a warm welcome from the Indian diaspora in Argentina.

title: CCTV Captures Bihar Businessman Gopal Khemka's Murder In Patna
content: The incident took place near the 'Panache' Hotel in the Gandhi Maidan police station area when Mr Khemka was on his way home.

title: Crores In Bribes, Top Officials And A Godman In India's Biggest Medical Scam
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has unearthed what it describes as one of the largest medical college scams in the country's history, spanning across multiple states, involving senior officials,, top educationists, and even a godman.

title: 36 Amarnath Pilgrims Injured After 5 Buses Collide In J&K's Ramban
content: Officials said the collision occurred due to the failure of the brakes of one of the buses in the convoy, which was headed for Pahalgam base camp from Jammu.

title: Rahul Gandhi's "Meekly Bow" Dig At PM Modi As Trump Deadline Draws Closer
content: Congress MP and Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi today claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will "meekly bow" to a deadline set by US President Donald Trump regarding reciprocal tariffs.

title: In Pics: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Plants Paddy, Says "Remembered Old Days"
content: Pushkar Singh Dhami said that farmers are "not only the backbone of our economy but also the carrier of culture and tradition".

title: Cop Asks For Rs 120 Petrol, Gets Worth Rs 720 Instead. Then Chaos Follows
content: The incident took place recently in Bihar's Sitamarhi district, where the police officer went to get petrol filled in his vehicle.

title: India Has Shown How Scale, Speed Can Go Hand-In-Hand: Finance Minister
content: India, with its dual role as a leading emerging economy and a global influencer, is uniquely positioned to lead the transformation not just for itself, but for all those who share its aspirations, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has stressed.

title: Days After Deadly Stampede, Security Increased For 'Bahuda Yatra' In Puri
content: Stringent security arrangements have been put in place for Lord Jagannath's 'Bahuda Yatra' in Odisha's Puri on Saturday, with which the Rath Yatra festivities will conclude, officials said.

title: Punjab Police Bust Arms-Drugs Module Run By Pak, Malaysian Handlers
content: Amritsar Police have busted an arms-narcotics module operated by handlers based in Pakistan and Malaysia, arresting nine persons in two separate cases, officials said on Friday.

title: Man Found Dead In Lift After Fire At Vishal Mega Mart In Delhi's Karol Bagh
content: A 25-year-old man was found dead inside a lift after a massive fire broke out at a Vishal Mega Mart outlet in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Friday.

title: Ladli Behna Yojana Monthly Aid To Increase To Rs 1,500 After Diwali: Mohan Yadav
content: More than 1.27 crore women beneficiaries of Madhya Pradesh government's flagship Ladli Behna Yojana will get a monthly aid of Rs 1,500 after Diwali, up from the current Rs 1,250, Chief Minister Mohan Yadav said.

title: Speeding SUV Crashes Into UP College Wall, Groom Among 8 Killed
content: Eight members of a family, including a 24-year-old groom, were killed and two others seriously injured when a Bolero SUV carrying a wedding party crashed into the wall of a college in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district on Friday.

title: "Supreme Court Is Not A Chief Justice-Centric Court": BR Gavai
content: Chief Justice of India (CJI) BR Gavai reaffirmed the Supreme Court's commitment to transparency in judicial appointments during a felicitation ceremony organised by the Bombay Bar Association.

title: UP Woman, Lover Attempt To Poison, Stab Husband, Sons: Police
content: The Uttar Pradesh Police has said they have arrested a woman and her lover for allegedly attempting to kill her husband and sons twice -- first by poisoning and then by stabbing.

title: Exclusive - Biology Beyond Earth: How Space Station Is Shaping Human Life in Space
content: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is visiting a home away from Earth that has seen continuous human presence for a quarter of a century and is floating around 400 kilometres above Earth.

title: Trump Signs 'Big, Beautiful Bill' Into Law. What's Inside
content: US President Donald Trump signed into law his "One Big Beautiful Bill" at the White House on Friday, "keeping" his campaign promises of extending tax cuts from his first term and boosting military spending.

title: Double Murder Witness Shot Dead In Delhi, Cops Suspect Gang War
content: Unidentified bike-borne gunmen shot dead their rival in the Najafgarh area of the national capital on Friday, police said.

title: 24 Killed, Over 20 Girls Missing From Summer Camp In Texas Flash Floods
content: Forecasters issued a flood warning for Kerr County, urging those living near the Guadalupe River to "move to higher ground."

content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: Jerry Rice gives Bucs WR Mike Evans blessing to break 1,000-yard record
content: hamstring injury came on the final play of the season . the six-time pro bowler missed three games last season with a knee injury . he now has his shot at sole possession of the record, and he gives him his blessing .

title: Fluminense were Club World Cup underdogs. Now they're 90 minutes from the final
content: Fluminense beat Al-Hilal 2-1 to reach the club world cup semi-finals . Renato Portaluppi says his team are the "ugly duckling" when compared with others in the last eight . the 62-year-old says he's right, and whatever gap might exist in terms of bank balance wasn't on show .

title: Canada striker David signs 5-year Juventus deal
content: Canada  forward  Jonathan David  signed a five-year contract with  Juventus  on Friday. After his five-year contract at  Lille  expired, David joined the record 36-time Italian champion on a free transfer. The deal is worth €6 million ($7 million) per season, with up to €2 million ($2.4 million) in bonuses, Gazzetta dello Sport reported. It's the first big market move by new Juventus general manager Damien Comolli, who confirmed last month that Igor Tudor will stay on as coach. Juventus needs firepower up front with  Dusan Vlahovic  having fallen out of favor and likely to leave the club. The 25-year-old David scored 25 goals and provided 12 assists in 49 matches across all competitions for Lille last season. David is also Canada's all-time leading scorer with 36 goals in 67 appearances.

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

content: ex-new york Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul owns a fourth of July accident that cost him 212 fingers . he has no choice but to be reminded of it when putting on a dress shirt and reaching for a button . "there's nothing to be embarrassed about," he tells ESPN last week .
